html:
• News

Put a Satechi OntheGo 3-in-1 Charger on a hotel nightstand and it’s ready to juice up your iPhone, Apple Watch and AirPods all at once. When it’s time to go, it folds up into a travel-friendly shape.

There’s also a 2-in-1 version, and both hit store shelves on Tuesday.

Take Satechi OntheGo 3-in-1 Charger on your next trip

Our iPhones, AirPods and Apple Watches get just as much use on holiday as they do when we’re at home. Maybe more. But keeping all their batteries powered is more challenging on trips. No one wants to tote around separate chargers for all their devices — they’re too bulky.

The Satechi OntheGo 3-in-1 Charger handles the problem. It provides speedy wireless charging for our precious gear in a travel-friendly design. With Qi2, it delivers 15W of power to a MagSafe-enabled iPhone and 5W of power to AirPods and/or an Apple Watch.

Or there’s the OntheGo 2-in-1 Charger, with two charging mats for those who carry slightly less gear. Both versions include a flip-up Apple Watch stand.

Either model folds up into a lightweight cylinder designed to fit easily in your luggage or backpack. Or use the folded-up shape as an iPhone charging stand.

They need only a single USB-C cable, which is included. But a wall power adapter is not. It’s up to users to pick one that provides enough juice for two or three devices. Satechi recommends 30W to 36W, depending on the model.

The accessories come in black, sand or desert rose colors.

Price and availability

The Satechi OntheGo 3-in-1 Charger launched Tuesday. It sells for $99.99.

Buy it from: Amazon

The Satechi OntheGo 2-in-1 Charger also just hit the market. It sells for $79.99.

Buy it from: Satechi

Intrigued? You might be interested in the Twelve South ButterFly, a rival travel charger with a similar design. We have a review of it.

Satechi OntheGo 3-in-1 Wireless Charger

This magnetic portable charger features a compact, lightweight design, making it the perfect travel charger. Its slim, circular shape fits easily into your pocket or carry-on.

Unfold it, and it’s ready to power to your iPhone at 15W and provide 5W of power to both your AirPods and your Apple Watch.
